page.title: 16Town Hall Cont.
page.content: dirting the same.' The White Hart hotel is one of the oldest buildings in Hythe with timber dating back from the 15th century. One room in the hotel was a robing room for the Mayor and it's supposed to connect with the Council Chamber. Montgomery and the American Ambassador stayed there in the 2nd World War to get information on flying bomb attacks. Corn and cattle markets were held under the Town Hall and in Market Hill.According to the Kentish Gazette someone who was employed to dig the Royal Military Canal brought his wife to market, tied her to a post and sold her for six pence. Up Market Hill is Manor House. The Deedes family used to live there until they moved to Sandling Park in 1800. Manor House looks like a Georgian house but dates back to the 17th century.
